incident_updates.body: A recent software update inadvertently altered the ordering of DNS records within our cached responses. Specifically, the sequence of CNAME and non-CNAME records in the "answer" section was changed, which conflicted with the expectations of certain DNS client implementations. Upon identifying this behavior, we reverted the release to restore standard record ordering and resolve connectivity issues for affected users.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating, an issue which potentially impacts users globally that use 1.1.1.1 public resolver. Further detail will be provided as more information becomes available.

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare single-file cache purging (purge by URL) called via the Dashboard/API is running up to 30 minutes behind in Eastern North America (ENAM). This also affects the "Always Online" feature.

We are working to resolve this issue as soon as possible. Until then you may use the Purge Everything feature but do be aware it may cause a surge in traffic to your origin server(s). More updates to follow.

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved.

A change made to how Cloudflare's Web Application Firewall parses requests caused Cloudflare's network to be unavailable for several minutes this morning. This was not an attack; the change was deployed by our team to help mitigate the industry-wide vulnerability disclosed this week in React Server Components.

More information can be found on our blog post: https://blog.cloudflare.com/5-december-2025-outage/
We are continuing to monitor the results.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard and related APIs.

Customers using the Dashboard / Cloudflare APIs are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.

incident_updates.body: The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating an issue with Durable Objects, Stream, R2, Log Explorer and Logs which potentially impacts multiple customers in the Western North America region. These features are experiencing elevated latency in the aforementioned region. We are currently investigating this issue.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

components.name: Durable Objects
components.description: Durable Objects provide low-latency coordination and consistent permanent storage for the Workers platform.

components.name: Log Explorer
components.description: Native observability and forensics. Store logs, detect security and performance issues, investigate root cause, and mitigate impact.

components.name: Logs
components.description: Enterprise Logpull and Logpush services

components.name: R2
components.description: High-performance storage for files and objects with zero egress charges

components.name: Stream
components.description: Cloudflare Stream lets you or your end users upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API, without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

incidents.name: Network Performance Issue Affecting Some Traffic Served from Frankfurt, Germany (FRA)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Cloudflare is currently investigating network performance issues affecting some traffic served from Frankfurt, Germany (FRA).

We are actively analyzing the impact and working to mitigate the problem. Further updates will be provided shortly.
This incident is now resolved.

As part of this issue, from 20:35 to 21:10 UTC some customers would have experienced elevated rates of HTTP 522 error responses for requests originating in Europe. We are continuing to monitor the effectiveness of our fix.
We have identified the cause of this issue and implemented a fix. We are currently monitoring the results.
We are investigating an issue with elevated dashboard login latency and timeouts for European users.

components.name: Dashboard
components.description: Dashboard where customers can view and make changes to their configurations at https://dash.cloudflare.com

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Cloudflare is investigating issues with network performance in Newark (EWR). We are working to analyze and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.
